Global Settings

What do you want to do?

Use the Event Dwell Limit setting to define the maximum number of samples the acquisition engine will wait after the injector voltage signal goes low before considering an injection event complete.

Use the Phase Dwell Limit setting to define the maximum number of samples the acquisition engine will wait after the injector voltage signal goes low before considering an injection phase complete.

Use the Battery Voltage Threshold setting to define the threshold used by the acquisition engine to determine the start and end of an injection event and intermediate injection phases within an event.

Use the Pull-In Current Threshold setting to define the threshold used by the acquisition engine to determine that a current maximum has occurred.

Use the Reset Event Counts? setting to reset all injection event counters.

Use the Voltage Gain setting to apply a gain or scaling to the voltage signal on the FPGA.

Use the Current Gain setting to apply a gain or scaling to the current signal on the FPGA.
